verses.kjv: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;
verses.web: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of God Most High, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,
verses.ct: This Melchizedek was king of Salem and a priest of God Most High. He met Abraham as Abraham was returning from defeating the kings, and he blessed him.

verses.kjv: To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
verses.web: to whom also Abraham divided a tenth part of all (being first, by interpretation, “king of righteousness”, and then also “king of Salem”, which means “king of peace”,
verses.ct: Abraham gave him a tenth of everything he had captured. Now, Melchizedek's name means "king of righteousness," and his title "king of Salem" means "king of peace."

verses.kjv: Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.
verses.web: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God), remains a priest continually.
verses.ct: There is no record of his father, mother, or ancestry — no record of his birth or death. Like the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.

verses.kjv: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
verses.web: Now consider how great this man was, to whom even Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the best plunder.
verses.ct: Think about how great this man was — even Abraham, the patriarch himself, gave him a tenth of the best plunder.

verses.kjv: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:
verses.web: They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest’s office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham,
verses.ct: Now, the law commands the descendants of Levi who serve as priests to collect a tenth from the people — their own fellow Israelites — even though they are all descendants of Abraham.

verses.kjv: But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.
verses.web: but he whose genealogy is not counted from them has accepted tithes from Abraham, and has blessed him who has the promises.
verses.ct: But Melchizedek, who wasn't even from the tribe of Levi, collected a tenth from Abraham and blessed the man who had received God's promises.

verses.kjv: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
verses.web: But without any dispute the lesser is blessed by the greater.
verses.ct: No one can argue with this: the one who gives the blessing is greater than the one who receives it.

verses.kjv: And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
verses.web: Here people who die receive tithes, but there one receives tithes of whom it is testified that he lives.
verses.ct: In the Levitical system, the men who collect tithes eventually die. But in Melchizedek's case, Scripture testifies that he lives on.

verses.kjv: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.
verses.web: We can say that through Abraham even Levi, who receives tithes, has paid tithes,
verses.ct: In a sense, you could even say that Levi — the ancestor of those who collect tithes — paid tithes through Abraham.

verses.kjv: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.
verses.web: for he was yet in the body of his father when Melchizedek met him.
verses.ct: After all, Levi was still an unborn descendant of Abraham when Melchizedek met him.

verses.kjv: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?
verses.web: Now if perfection was through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people have received the law), what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be called after the order of Aaron?
verses.ct: If the Levitical priesthood could have made people perfect — and it was the foundation for the law the people received — why would there be any need for a different kind of priest, one in the order of Melchizedek rather than the order of Aaron?

verses.kjv: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.
verses.web: For the priesthood being changed, there is of necessity a change made also in the law.
verses.ct: When the priesthood changes, the law that established it must change too.

verses.kjv: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.
verses.web: For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe, from which no one has officiated at the altar.
verses.ct: The one we're talking about belongs to a completely different tribe — one that has never had anyone serve at the altar.

verses.kjv: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.
verses.web: For it is evident that our Lord has sprung out of Judah, about which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.
verses.ct: It's clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and Moses never said anything about priests coming from that tribe.

verses.kjv: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,
verses.web: This is yet more abundantly evident, if after the likeness of Melchizedek there arises another priest,
verses.ct: This becomes even more obvious when another priest appears who is like Melchizedek —

verses.kjv: Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.
verses.web: who has been made, not after the law of a fleshly commandment, but after the power of an endless life;
verses.ct: someone who became a priest not because of a law about physical ancestry, but through the power of a life that never ends.

verses.kjv: For he testifieth, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.web: for it is testified, “You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.ct: For Scripture declares about him, "You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek."

verses.kjv: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.
verses.web: For there is an annulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and uselessness
verses.ct: The earlier commandment about the priesthood was set aside because it was weak and couldn't accomplish its purpose.

verses.kjv: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto God.
verses.web: (for the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in of a better hope, through which we draw near to God.
verses.ct: The law never made anything perfect. But now a better hope has been introduced, and through it we can draw near to God.

verses.kjv: And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest:
verses.web: Inasmuch as he was not made priest without the taking of an oath
verses.ct: What makes this even more significant is that God confirmed it with an oath.

verses.kjv: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)
verses.web: (for they indeed have been made priests without an oath), but he with an oath by him that says of him, “The Lord swore and will not change his mind, ‘You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.’ ”
verses.ct: The Levitical priests were appointed without any oath, but Jesus was appointed with an oath when God said to him, "The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: 'You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.'"

verses.kjv: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.
verses.web: By so much, Jesus has become the collateral of a better covenant.
verses.ct: Because of this oath, Jesus himself is the guarantee of a far better covenant.

verses.kjv: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:
verses.web: Many, indeed, have been made priests, because they are hindered from continuing by death.
verses.ct: Under the old system, there had to be many priests, because death prevented any of them from serving permanently.

verses.kjv: But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.
verses.web: But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable.
verses.ct: But because Jesus lives forever, his priesthood never passes to anyone else.

verses.kjv: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.
verses.web: Therefore he is also able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him, seeing that he lives forever to make intercession for them.
verses.ct: That's why he is able to save completely and forever everyone who comes to God through him, because he is always alive to speak to God on their behalf.

verses.kjv: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
verses.web: For such a high priest was fitting for us: holy, guiltless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
verses.ct: This is exactly the kind of high priest we need — one who is holy, blameless, pure, set apart from sinners, and exalted above the heavens.

verses.kjv: Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people’s: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.
verses.web: who doesn’t need, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices daily, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. For he did this once for all, when he offered up himself.
verses.ct: Unlike the other high priests, he doesn't need to offer sacrifices day after day — first for his own sins, then for the people's. He offered one sacrifice, once and for all, when he offered himself.

verses.kjv: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, maketh the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.
verses.web: For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the word of the oath which came after the law appoints a Son forever who has been perfected.
verses.ct: The law appoints men with weaknesses as high priests. But the oath God swore — which came after the law — appoints the Son, who has been made perfect forever.
